channel.title: Strange slew presence on step sequencer sub patch
channel.description: Hello, I am having some trouble with this step sequencer I made. It mostly works, however i've found that there is always a noticeable amount of slew between pitch "cv" level changes, and im not sure why. I ahve it set up so that there is a k-rate filter operating as an actual slew, however i have it also set up so that the slew generator can be completely removed from the signal path. However i find that even in this scenario(slew muxed out) it still has a noticeable slew between pitch on steps, like if i set step 1 to -34, and step two to -24, and step 3 to -34 with the glide/slew/portamento disabled, and with the gate out of the steps 1 and 3 disabled, it will still have a noticeable pitch slew effect on step 2(sliding in from step 1's value to step 3's value) Any advice, or help would be welcome. Feel free to modify or use these sequencers for whatever you feel like also. GateSequencer.axs (16.7 KB)StepSequencer.axs (25.9 KB)

item.title: Strange slew presence on step sequencer sub patch
item.dc:creator: @debterminer Jason Dickson
item.description:
@debterminer wrote:

i included the gate sequencer subpatch as it is a part of the stepsequencer sub patch as well and i believe will need to be placed in the same folder as it for it to work properly. I place them in the objects folder myself for ease of use with the other sequencer type things.

Read full topic
item.source: Strange slew presence on step sequencer sub patch

item.title: Strange slew presence on step sequencer sub patch
item.dc:creator: @debterminer Jason Dickson
item.description:
@debterminer wrote:

Hello, I am having some trouble with this step sequencer I made. It mostly works, however i've found that there is always a noticeable amount of slew between pitch "cv" level changes, and im not sure why. I ahve it set up so that there is a k-rate filter operating as an actual slew, however i have it also set up so that the slew generator can be completely removed from the signal path. However i find that even in this scenario(slew muxed out) it still has a noticeable slew between pitch on steps, like if i set step 1 to -34, and step two to -24, and step 3 to -34 with the glide/slew/portamento disabled, and with the gate out of the steps 1 and 3 disabled, it will still have a noticeable pitch slew effect on step 2(sliding in from step 1's value to step 3's value) Any advice, or help would be welcome. Feel free to modify or use these sequencers for whatever you feel like also.
GateSequencer.axs (16.7 KB)StepSequencer.axs (25.9 KB)

Read full topic
